name: VADOO Sling Bag - Anti-theft Crossbody Shoulder Bag for Men and Women (Black)
reviews: Got the OG Black V1 version of this item.  Lots of pockets with zippers, and a magnetic strap on top for easier access.  You can fit a phone, kindle, and passport sized documents into it no problem.The bag slings over your left shoulder, to allow your right hand to reach it easily.  Being water resistant, it traps in both heat and sweat -- something to note for vigorous activities.  I am considerably warmer wearing this thing than not when going outdoors.This fits under a jacket easily, and a passerby won't notice it with just a phone and some documents.Another review said this thing can fit a pistol, and I think that's accurate.  You probably don't want people mistake it for a holster as you reach for items inside your jacket.  Just something to note.Overall, a good travel bag.  Been sturdy from the usages I've had in the past week.

reviews: I recently purchased the Telena Sling Bag for a Christmas gift, and I couldn't be more thrilled with my choice. The compact size makes it ideal for everyday use, yet it offers ample storage space for essentials. The thoughtful compartmentalization allows for easy organization, ensuring that everything has its place without sacrificing style.The adjustable crossbody strap provides added convenience, allowing you to wear it comfortably and securely. Whether you're heading out for a casual day of shopping or attending a more formal event, this bag seamlessly transitions to suit any occasion.I also appreciate the modern and chic aesthetic of the bag. The minimalistic yet stylish design makes it a timeless accessory that complements various outfits. It's the kind of bag that not only adds a touch of sophistication to your ensemble but also proves to be a practical and functional choice.In conclusion, the Telena Small Sling Bag for Women exceeded my expectations in terms of quality, design, and functionality. name: Telena Sling Bag for Women Leather Fanny Pack Crossboday Backpack Brown
reviews: I've been carrying a lulu belt bag for quick errands around town now that my kids are hitting an age where I don't need all the extra "stuff" on me at all times. The downside to that is the smaller size and lack of individual compartments. I don't want to unzip the bag to get cash out only to see my car keys fall out. When I travel I like being able to have just my travel day necessities easy to access....phone, money/cards, passport, boarding passes, airpods, etc. Especially with kids, the last thing I want to be doing is stopping to rummage through a backpack.My lulu bag served me well but I've been looking for something a little bigger, that isn't too bulky, but has separate compartments. This bag is honestly perfect. I was super impressed with the quality for the price point. So far I've only been carrying it around town, but will be flying internationally with it soon. I've been able to fit my cash/cards in the back zippered section, and the front two sections have plenty of space for sunglasses, phone, keys, etc. I've been able to fit an small pack of wipes, an extra pair of thin pants for my potty training toddler, and my sunglasses all in the larger section of the pouch with no problems.
